result.execSummary:
The defendant Vincent R. Bourdon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Disorderly conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 1 day only if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns.

The defendant must submit a DNA sample.

The defendant must enroll and participate in an anger management program and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must follow thru and comply with any aftercare and treatment plans from his recent AODA program.

defendant.name: Bourdon, Vincent R.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Vincent R. Bourdon in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:04 AM. State - here for change of plea - amends count #1 to county ordinance of DC, enter plea to amended count, $500.00 fine plus costs, plead to count #2 as alleged, #3 - DRI, 12 months probation with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, maintain absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol, no entry into any taverns, bars, or similar establishments, employment/school, 25 hours of community service. Bourdon and Voorhees agree. Court dismisses and reads in count #3. Court amends count #1 to county ordinance of DC, plead G, finds G, fine of $500.00 plus costs totalling $834.50 - take bond posted - remainder due in 60 days/CO. Bourdon pleads G to count #2 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, recess to have counsel go over the elements with the defendant (11:07 AM). Back on record at 11:07 AM. Court now has the element sheet with the plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty. State - follow joint recommendation. Voorhees - providese court with a copy of a note from the AODA program that the defendant completed - follow joint recommendation. Bourdon withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: #2 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year with conditions of: AODA and follow thru and to comply with any aftercare and treatment plans from his recent AODA program, anger management and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 25 hours of community service, costs - paid thru probation, submit DNA sample with expunction rights given, credit for 1 day only if revoked, right to appeal, adjourned.
Final pre-trial on November 4, 2016 at 11:00 am.
No consumption of alcohol, must reside with his parents at 5263 Youngs Lane, Crandon, WI  54520

Defendant Vincent R. Bourdon in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:14 AM. Bourdon does not have complaint. State provides complaint in Court. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Bourdon understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, recess to talk to SPD. Recalled at 9:58 AM, does qualify for SPD and appears with John Voorhees, enters NG pleas to all counts, asks for signature bond for stated reasons. State - bond - makes statement regarding repeated patterns of the defendant, would like some restrictions if amended to signature bond, one would be to not be able to reside at 105 North Wildwood Avenue. Court - bond - amends to $500.00 signature bond, no consumption of alcohol, must reside with his parents at 5263 Youngs Lane.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 4, 2016 at 11:00 am.
